page.title: 10St. Leonard's Church
page.content: St. Leonard's Church was built round about the year 1180 and later on, during restoration work in 1870, the Tower was demolished. When the Church was rebuilt, several carved stones were found. These stones can be seen today in the Bell Ringing Chamber. In the year 1448, the first tower was built by Richard Horde who lived at Horde's Park, which was on the road to Broseley. A year later, Richard Horde died and he asked, in his will, to be buried under the arch of the new tower which he had built. In a battle between the Parliamentary Forces and the Royalists, Colonel Billingsley was killed and his sword is kept in a case in St. Leonard's Church where it can still be seen today. Now, in 1985, St. Leonard's Church is being repaired and restored and will soon be open to the public.
